title: Forecast/Advisory GIS
text: Lines Polygons spatial dataframes can helpfully converted using shp_to_df. original spatial dataframes can plotted directly ggplot2 , understanding, access variables available. Points dataframes can just converted tibble::as_data_frame. Modify shp_storm_pts$DVLBL full strings ordered factor. shp_storm_pts$TCWW:  often, areas hurricane watch may also tropical storm warning. chart show hurricane watch area.
code: # Convert object SpatialLinesDataframe to dataframe shp_storm_lin <- shp_to_df(gis_adv$al092008.042_5day_lin) shp_storm_ww <- shp_to_df(gis_adv$al092008.042_ww_wwlin) # Convert object SpatialPolygonsDataframe to dataframe shp_storm_pgn <- shp_to_df(gis_adv$al092008.042_5day_pgn) # Convert object SpatialPointsDataframe to dataframe shp_storm_pts <- as_data_frame(gis_adv$al092008.042_5day_pts) ## Warning: `as_data_frame()` was deprecated in tibble 2.0.0. ## Please use `as_tibble()` instead. ## The signature and semantics have changed, see `?as_tibble`. ## This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. ## Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was generated. shp_storm_pts$DVLBL <- factor(shp_storm_pts$DVLBL,                                levels = c("D", "S", "H"),                                labels = c("Tropical Depression",                                           "Tropical Storm",                                           "Hurricane")) shp_storm_ww$TCWW <- factor(shp_storm_ww$TCWW,                              levels = c("TWA", "TWR", "HWA", "HWR"),                              labels = c("Tropical Storm Watch",                                         "Tropical Storm Warning",                                         "Hurricane Watch",                                         "Hurricane Warning")) bpi + geom_polygon(data = shp_storm_pgn,                     aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group),                    alpha = 0.15, fill = "orange") +      geom_path(data = shp_storm_lin, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group)) +      geom_point(data = shp_storm_pts, aes(x = LON, y = LAT, fill = DVLBL,                                          shape = DVLBL, size = MAXWIND)) +      geom_path(data = shp_storm_ww, aes(x = long, y = lat, color = TCWW,                                         group = group), size = 1) +      scale_shape_manual(values = c(21, 21, 21, 21)) +      guides(shape = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 3)),             size = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +      theme(legend.position = "bottom",            legend.box = "vertical")

title: Getting Started
text: Let’s look example current details. important variable dataset Key. Key unique identifier storm develops either basin. formatted “AABBCCCC” “AA” basin abbreviation (AL EP), “BB” year number storm left-padded, “CC” year storm. Adv second-important variable . ’ll notice character format. regularly-scheduled advisories, advisory numbers always numeric. However, watches warnings effect, intermediate advisories issued given alpha suffixes; .e., 1, 2, 3, 3A, 4, 4A, 4B, 5, etc. Public Advisory (public) issued frequently. regular products (discus, fstadv, prblty, wndprb) generally issued every six hours. Status lists current designation cyclone, .e., Tropical Depression, Tropical Storm, etc. Name given storm crosses threshold Tropical Storm; , winds greater 33kts. Lat Lon current position storm within PosAcc nautical miles. distance measurements nautical miles. Wind Gust current one-minute sustained wind speeds knots (kts). can use function knots_to_mph convert . wind speed values knots. code: str(df.gis_adv$al182012.018_5day_lin) ## Formal class 'SpatialLinesDataFrame' [package "sp"] with 4 slots ##   ..@ data       :'data.frame':  2 obs. of  7 variables: ##   .. ..$ STORMNAME: chr [1:2] "SANDY" "SANDY" ##   .. ..$ STORMTYPE: chr [1:2] "HU" "HU" ##   .. ..$ ADVDATE  : chr [1:2] "121026/2100" "121026/2100" ##   .. ..$ ADVISNUM : chr [1:2] "18" "18" ##   .. ..$ STORMNUM : num [1:2] 18 18 ##   .. ..$ FCSTPRD  : num [1:2] 72 120 ##   .. ..$ BASIN    : chr [1:2] "al" "al" ##   ..@ lines      :List of 2 ##   .. ..$ :Formal class 'Lines' [package "sp"] with 2 slots ##   .. .. .. ..@ Lines:List of 1 ##   .. .. .. .. ..$ :Formal class 'Line' [package "sp"] with 1 slot ##   .. .. .. .. .. .. ..@ coords: num [1:6, 1:2] -77.1 -77 -76.1 -74.3 -72.6 ... ##   .. .. .. ..@ ID   : chr "0" ##   .. ..$ :Formal class 'Lines' [package "sp"] with 2 slots ##   .. .. .. ..@ Lines:List of 1 ##   .. .. .. .. ..$ :Formal class 'Line' [package "sp"] with 1 slot ##   .. .. .. .. .. .. ..@ coords: num [1:8, 1:2] -77.1 -77 -76.1 -74.3 -72.6 ... ##   .. .. .. ..@ ID   : chr "1" ##   ..@ bbox       : num [1:2, 1:2] -77.1 27.3 -71.5 41 ##   .. ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 ##   .. .. ..$ : chr [1:2] "x" "y" ##   .. .. ..$ : chr [1:2] "min" "max" ##   ..@ proj4string:Formal class 'CRS' [package "sp"] with 1 slot ##   .. .. ..@ projargs: chr "+proj=longlat +a=6371200 +b=6371200 +no_defs" fcst_line <-    shp_to_df(df.gis_adv$al182012.018_5day_lin) p + geom_path(data = fcst_line,                aes(long, lat, group = FCSTPRD)) (bb <- sp::bbox(df.gis_adv$al182012.018_5day_lin)) ##     min   max ## x -77.1 -71.5 ## y  27.3  41.0 (p2 <- p + geom_path(data = fcst_line, aes(long, lat, group = FCSTPRD)) +      coord_equal(xlim = c(bb[1,1] - 5, bb[1,2] + 5),                  ylim = c(bb[2,1] - 5, bb[2,2] + 5))) ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one.

title: GIS data
text: forecast position also included points dataframe. can access df.gis_adv$al182012.018_5day_pts@data object; conversion necessary.

title: GIS data
text: Forecast cone data contained polygon dataset. deal dataset can use shp_to_df function take slightly longer way:  Note GIS packages forecast cones may identical (though shouldn’t ). ’ve noticed Hurricanes Ike Matthew; ’s raw dataset.
code: fcst_cone <- df.gis_adv$al182012.018_5day_pgn fcst_cone@data$id <- rownames(fcst_cone@data) fcst_cone.points <- broom::tidy(fcst_cone, region = "id") ## Warning in showSRID(uprojargs, format = "PROJ", multiline = "NO", prefer_proj ## = prefer_proj): Discarded ellps unknown in Proj4 definition: +proj=longlat ## +R=6371200 +no_defs +type=crs ## Warning in showSRID(uprojargs, format = "PROJ", multiline = "NO", prefer_proj = ## prefer_proj): Discarded datum unknown in Proj4 definition fcst_cone <- dplyr::left_join(fcst_cone.points, fcst_cone@data, by = "id") p3 + geom_polygon(data = fcst_cone %>% filter(FCSTPRD == 120),                   aes(long, lat, group = group, fill = factor(FCSTPRD)),                   alpha = 0.5) +      geom_polygon(data = fcst_cone %>% filter(FCSTPRD == 72),                   aes(long, lat, group = group, fill = factor(FCSTPRD)),                   alpha = 0.5)

title: GIS data
text: can also plot watches warnings effect package release time.  example can see tropical storm warnings issued Bahamas, North Carolina portions South Carolina Florida coast tropical storm watches effect northern Florida South Carolina.
code: ww_line <- shp_to_df(df.gis_adv$al182012.018_ww_wwlin) p3 + geom_path(data = ww_line,                 aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group, color = TCWW), size = 1)

title: GIS data
text: Tropical Cyclone Storm Surge Probabilities data shows probability, percent, specified storm surge occurring forecast period indicated. product based upon ensemble Sea, Lake, Overland Surge Hurricanes (SLOSH) model runs using National Hurricane Center (NHC) official advisory accounts track, size, intensity errors based historical errors.
code: gis_prob_storm_surge(key = "AL142016",                    products = list(psurge = 0),                       datetime = "20161006") ## [1] "https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gis/storm_surge/al142016_psurge0_2016100600.zip" ## [2] "https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gis/storm_surge/al142016_psurge0_2016100606.zip" ## [3] "https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gis/storm_surge/al142016_psurge0_2016100612.zip" ## [4] "https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gis/storm_surge/al142016_psurge0_2016100618.zip" df.gis_storm_surge <-    gis_prob_storm_surge(key = "AL142016",                     products = list(psurge = 0),                    datetime = "20161006") %>%    last() %>%    gis_download() prob_surge <- shp_to_df(df.gis_storm_surge$al142016_2016100618_gt0) ## Warning in RGEOSUnaryPredFunc(spgeom, byid, "rgeos_isvalid"): Ring Self- ## intersection at or near point -81.136932369999997 25.789945599999999 ## Warning in RGEOSUnaryPredFunc(spgeom, byid, "rgeos_isvalid"): Ring Self- ## intersection at or near point -85.46185303 29.966722489999999 ## Warning in RGEOSUnaryPredFunc(spgeom, byid, "rgeos_isvalid"): Ring Self- ## intersection at or near point -81.25689697 25.743593220000001 ## Warning in RGEOSUnaryPredFunc(spgeom, byid, "rgeos_isvalid"): Ring Self- ## intersection at or near point -76.067649840000001 35.958679199999999 ## Warning in RGEOSUnaryPredFunc(spgeom, byid, "rgeos_isvalid"): Ring Self- ## intersection at or near point -81.021675110000004 25.239685059999999 ## Warning in RGEOSUnaryPredFunc(spgeom, byid, "rgeos_isvalid"): Ring Self- ## intersection at or near point -81.640518189999995 29.382949830000001 ## SpP is invalid ## Warning in rgeos::gUnaryUnion(spgeom = SpP, id = IDs): Invalid objects found; ## consider using set_RGEOS_CheckValidity(2L) bb <- sp::bbox(df.gis_storm_surge$al142016_2016100618_gt0) p + geom_path(data = prob_surge,                 aes(x = long, y = lat,                     group = group,                     color = PSurge00c),                size = 1, alpha = 0.5) +      coord_equal(xlim = c(bb[1,1], bb[1,2]),                 ylim = c(bb[2,1], bb[2,2])) ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one.

what: Current and Forecast Wind Field Radii
title: GIS data
text: Wind radii data may also available cyclone advisory packages. radius minimum sustained wind speed may felt center circulation.  Additionally, forecast wind radii data also generally available packages
code: gis_windfield("AL142016", advisory = "33") ## [1] "https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/gis/forecast/archive/al142016_fcst_033.zip" df.gis_wind_radii <- gis_windfield("AL142016", advisory = "33") %>% gis_download() wf_init <- shp_to_df(df.gis_wind_radii$al142016_2016100606_initialradii) bb <- sp::bbox(df.gis_wind_radii$al142016_2016100606_forecastradii) (p4 <- p + geom_polygon(data = wf_init,                    aes(x = long, y = lat, fill = factor(RADII)), alpha = 0.5) +      coord_equal(xlim = c(bb[1,1], bb[1,2]), ylim = c(bb[2,1], bb[2,2]))) ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one. wf_fcst <- shp_to_df(df.gis_wind_radii$al142016_2016100606_forecastradii) p4 + geom_polygon(data = wf_fcst,                    aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group, fill = factor(RADII)),                    alpha = 0.5)

title: Probabilistic Storm Surge
code: key <- "AL092008" adv <- 42 fstadv <- fstadv %>% filter(Key == key, Adv <= adv)

title: Probabilistic Storm Surge
text: Calculate last date/time forecast/advisory product subtract 3 hrs Wrap gis_download safely. products exist every storm even every advisory. ’m downloading psurge products 5 feet since storm surge products available Ike. Generate base plot Atlantic ocean. Since ’re dealing polygon shapefile, can get bounding box dataset. Add little cushion map inset. Build map inset. Modify original bp zoomed area interest. Combine bp bp_inset finalize initial base plot. bp base plot without inset. bpi inset. Convert SpatialPolygonsDataframe dataframe. Probability storm surge greater five feet.
code: dt <- (last(fstadv$Date) - (60 * 60 * 3)) %>%      strftime(format = "%Y%m%d%H", tz = "UTC") dl <- purrr::safely(.f = gis_download) gis_surge <- gis_prob_storm_surge(key, products = list("psurge" = c(5)),                                    datetime = dt) %>% dl() ## Warning in OGRSpatialRef(dsn, layer, morphFromESRI = morphFromESRI, dumpSRS ## = dumpSRS, : Discarded ellps NCEP_SPHERE in Proj4 definition: +proj=longlat ## +R=6371200 +no_defs ## Warning in OGRSpatialRef(dsn, layer, morphFromESRI = morphFromESRI, dumpSRS ## = dumpSRS, : Discarded datum NCEP_SPHERE in Proj4 definition: +proj=longlat ## +R=6371200 +no_defs ## Warning in showSRID(wkt2, "PROJ"): Discarded ellps NCEP_SPHERE in Proj4 ## definition: +proj=longlat +R=6371200 +no_defs +type=crs ## Warning in showSRID(wkt2, "PROJ"): Discarded datum NCEP_SPHERE in Proj4 ## definition ## OGR data source with driver: ESRI Shapefile  ## Source: "/tmp/RtmpavP8B6", layer: "al092008_2008091112_gt5" ## with 83 features ## It has 2 fields if (!is.null(gis_surge$error))     message(gis_surge$error) bp <- al_tracking_chart(color = "black", fill = "white", size = 0.1, res = 50) ## Regions defined for each Polygons ## Regions defined for each Polygons ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one. bbox <- bbox(gis_surge$result$al092008_2008091112_gt5) lat_min <- bbox[2,1] - 2 lat_max <- bbox[2,2] + 2 lon_min <- bbox[1,1] - 4 lon_max <- bbox[1,2] + 4 bp_inset <- ggplotGrob(bp +     geom_rect(mapping = aes(xmin = lon_min, xmax = lon_max,                             ymin = lat_min, ymax = lat_max),               color = "red", alpha = 0) +     theme_bw() +     theme(axis.title = element_blank(),           axis.ticks = element_blank(),           axis.text.x = element_blank(),           axis.text.y = element_blank(),           plot.margin = margin(0, 0, 0, 0, "pt"))) bp <- bp +     coord_equal(xlim = c(lon_min, lon_max),                 ylim = c(lat_min, lat_max)) +     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +     scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +     labs(x = "Lon",          y = "Lat",          caption = sprintf("rrricanes %s", packageVersion("rrricanes"))) ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one. bpi <- bp + annotation_custom(grob = bp_inset, xmin = lon_max - 5,                              xmax = lon_max - 1, ymin = -Inf,                              ymax = lat_min + 5) shp_storm_surge <- shp_to_df(gis_surge$result$al092008_2008091112_gt5) ## what: Forecast/Advisory Data for Hurricane Ike Adv #42
title: Wind and Pressure
code: fstadv <- fstadv %>% filter(Key == key, Adv <= adv)

title: Wind and Pressure
code: # Plot wind values fstadv %>% ggplot(aes(x = Date, y = Wind)) +    geom_line() +    geom_point(aes(color = Status), size = 3) +    scale_y_continuous(name = "Wind (kts)") +    theme_bw() +    theme(legend.position = "bottom",          legend.box = "vertical") +   labs(title = "Wind Profile",         caption = sprintf("rrricanes %s", packageVersion("rrricanes")))

title: Wind and Pressure
code: # Plot pressure values fstadv %>% ggplot(aes(x = Date, y = Pressure)) +    geom_line() +    geom_point(aes(color = Status), size = 3) +    scale_y_continuous(name = "Pressure (mb)") +    theme_bw() +    theme(legend.position = "bottom",          legend.box = "vertical") +   labs(title = "Pressure Profile",         caption = sprintf("rrricanes %s", packageVersion("rrricanes")))

title: Wind and Pressure
code: fstadv %>%   mutate(WindDist = (Wind - min(Wind))/(max(Wind) - min(Wind)),          PressDist = (Pressure - max(Pressure))/(max(Pressure) - min(Pressure))) %>%   gather(Var, Val, WindDist, PressDist) %>%    ggplot(aes(x = Date, y = Val, group = Var, color = Var)) +    geom_line(size = 1) +    scale_color_discrete(labels = c("Pressure Change", "Wind Change")) +    theme_bw() +    theme(legend.position = "bottom",          legend.title = element_blank()) +    labs(title = "Wind/Pressure Relational Change",         subtitle = "",        caption = sprintf("rrricanes %s", packageVersion("rrricanes")),         y = "")

title: Wind and Pressure
text: One interesting things note image ; Hurricane Ike known ’s large wind field (relatively speaking) generated larger wider storm surge normal ’s classification. can see well defined structure expansion advisories 38 42. , part, led modification Saffir Simpson Hurricane Scale. large Hurricane Ike (hurricane force winds extending much 125 mi center) 2008 made landfall Texas Category 2 hurricane peak storm surge values 20 ft. contrast, tiny Hurricane Charley (hurricane force winds extending 25 mi center) struck Florida 2004 Category 4 hurricane produced peak storm surge 7 ft. storm surge values substantially outside ranges suggested original scale. Thus help reduce public confusion impacts associated various hurricane categories well provide scientifically defensible scale, storm surge ranges, flooding impact central pressure statements removed scale peak winds employed revised version – Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale. (Schott et al. 2012)

text: Generate base plot Atlantic ocean.  like add little cushion map inset forecast cone data. Build thin tracking map inset. Modify original bp zoomed area interest.  Combine bp bp_inset finalize initial base plot. bp base plot without inset. bpi inset.  wndprb coordinates cities. option al_prblty_stations. However, please note function may become deprecated. Check wndprb NA values Lat, Lon.
code: bp <- al_tracking_chart(color = "black", fill = "white", size = 0.1, res = 50) ## Regions defined for each Polygons ## Regions defined for each Polygons ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one. bp lat_min <- bbox[2,1] - 5 lat_max <- bbox[2,2] + 5 lon_min <- bbox[1,1] - 10 lon_max <- bbox[1,2] + 10 bp_inset <- ggplotGrob(bp +                            geom_rect(mapping = aes(xmin = lon_min, xmax = lon_max,                                                    ymin = lat_min, ymax = lat_max),                                      color = "red", alpha = 0) +                            theme_bw() +                            theme(axis.title = element_blank(),                                  axis.ticks = element_blank(),                                  axis.text.x = element_blank(),                                  axis.text.y = element_blank(),                                  plot.margin = margin(0, 0, 0, 0, "pt"))) bp <- bp +     coord_equal(xlim = c(lon_min, lon_max),                 ylim = c(lat_min, lat_max)) +     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +     scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0, 0)) +     labs(x = "Lon",          y = "Lat",          caption = sprintf("rrricanes %s", packageVersion("rrricanes"))) ## Coordinate system already present. Adding new coordinate system, which will replace the existing one. bp bpi <- bp + annotation_custom(grob = bp_inset, xmin = lon_max - 5,                               xmax = lon_max - 1, ymin = -Inf,                               ymax = lat_min + 5) bpi wndprb <-      wndprb %>%      left_join(al_prblty_stations(), by = "Location") %>%      mutate_at(.vars = c("Lat", "Lon"), .funs = as.numeric) ## Warning: Expected 7 pieces. Additional pieces discarded in 1 rows [90]. any(is.na(wndprb$Lat), is.na(wndprb$Lon)) ## [1] TRUE wndprb_adv42 <- filter(wndprb, Adv == adv, Wind >= 64)  bpi +     geom_point(         data = wndprb_adv42,          aes(             x = Lon,             y = Lat,              color = Wind120Cum,             size = Wind120Cum         )     ) +      scale_color_gradientn(colors = terrain.colors(10)) +      guides(size = FALSE) +      theme(         legend.position = "bottom",          legend.box = "vertical"     ) +      labs(title = "Total Probability of Wind >= 64kts within 120 Hours") ## Warning: `guides(<scale> = FALSE)` is deprecated. title: Web Scraper for Atlantic and East Pacific Hurricanes and Tropical Storms
text: rrricanes R library extracts information available archives past current tropical cyclones. Currently, archives date back 1998. Data can obtained cyclones north Atlantic (considered Atlantic Basin) north-eastern Pacific (East Pacific Basin 140°W eastward. Central Pacific data (140°W 180°W) included issued National Hurricane Center (generally ’re issued Central Pacific Hurricane Center). library parses text advisories tropical cyclones since 1998. years formats text products changed many loosely formatted. wrote package goal consolidating messy text data well-organized formats can easily saved CSV, SQL data formats.

title: Web Scraper for Atlantic and East Pacific Hurricanes and Tropical Storms
text: Generally speaking, five products available tropical cyclones issued 03:00, 09:00, 15:00 21:00 UTC; Storm Discussion - technical discussions centered current structure cyclone, satellite presentation, computer forecast model tendencies . Forecast/Adivsory - data-rich product lists current location cyclone, wind structure, forecast forecast wind structure. Public Advisory - general text statements issued public--large. Information products summary Forecast/Advisory product along watches warnings issued, changed, cancelled. Public Advisory products regularly-scheduled product may issued intermittently (every three hours , occasionally, every two hours) watches warnings effect. Wind Speed Probabilities - products list probability minimum sustained wind speed expected given forecast window. product replaces Strike Probabilities product beginning 2006 (see ). Updates - Tropical Cyclone Updates may issued time storm immediate threat land cyclone undergoes significant change strength structure. information product general. Discontinued Products products included package though discontinued point: Strike Probabilities - List probability tropical cyclone passing within 65 nautical miles location within forecast window. Replaced 2006 Wind Speed Probabilities product. Position Estimates - Typically issued storm threatening land generally rare (see Hurricane Ike 2008, Key AL092008). generally just update current location cyclone. 2011 hurricane season, product discontinued; Updates now issued place.

title: get_storm_data — get_storm_data
text: get_storm_data wrapper function make   convenient access various storm products. Types products: discus Storm Discussions. technical information   cyclone satellite presentation, forecast model evaluation, etc. fstadv Forecast/Advisory. products contain meat   advisory package. Current storm information available well   structural design forecast data. posest Position Estimate. Issued generally storm   threatening; provides brief update location winds. public Public Advisory. Issued public knowledge; often   Atlantic East Pacific storms. Contains general information. prblty Strike Probability. Discontinued 2005 hurricane   season, strike probabilities list chances x-force winds   particular city. update Cyclone Update. Generally issued significant change   occurs cyclone. windprb Wind Probability. Replace strike probabilities beginning   2006 season. Nearly identical. Progress bars displayed default. can turned setting dplyr.show_progress FALSE. Additionally, can display messages advisory worked setting rrricanes.working_msg TRUE.

text: get_storm_data can used select multiple products, multiple storms multiple basins. Additional text products : get_discus Storm Discussions get_fstadv Forecast/Advisory. products contain   bulk information tropical cyclones including current position,   structure, forecast position forecast structure. get_posest Position Estimates. Rare used generally   threatening cyclones. product discontinued 2013   season now issued get_update. get_prblty Strike Probabilities. Show probability   center cyclone passing within 65nm location given   forecast period. product discontinued 2005, replaced   get_wndprb. get_public Public Advisory. General non-structured   information exists products. get_update Updates. Generally issued cyclone   undergoes sudden change requires immediate notice. get_wndprb Wind Speed Probability. Lists   probability location experiencing minimum 35kt, 50kt 64kt   winds alotted forecast period accumulated probability.   product replaced get_prblty 2005 season. products may take time load NHC website slow (often case, unfortunately). storm advisories issued outside current month, use rrricanesdata package. install rrricanesdata, run install.packages("rrricanesdata",          repos = "https://timtrice.github.io/drat/",          type = "source") See vignette("installing_rrricanesdata", package = "rrricanes") information.

title: rrricanes 0.2.0-1 (2017-06-16)
text: GIS functions now available. Please note products may exist every available cyclone/advisory. gis_advisory Typically include current past track data, forecast track data, forecast cone (margin error) wind radius data. gis_breakpoints List breakpoints typically used watch/warning areas requirement. gis_latest Retrieves latest GIS products active storms. gis_outlook Retrives latest tropical weather outlook shapefile format. gis_prob_storm_surge Probabilistic storm surge; polygon dataset psurge esurge products various criteria. gis_windfield Wind radius datasets. gis_wsp Wind speed probabilities gis_download Use function download URLs returned functions. shp_to_df added convert lines polygons spatial dataframes dataframes. Points dataframes can converted using tibble::as_dataframe (target @data object).

title: rrricanes 0.2.0-1 (2017-06-16)
text: Enhanced documentation added online using pkgdown. load_storm_data directly returns dataframes. Additionally, retrieval basin years removed favor importing complete product datasets. Additionally, documentation added website using data.world third option. difference two options load_storm_data return complete datasets. Using data.world allow users write custom queries retrieve data. (#76)

title: rrricanes 0.1.2 (2017-06-08)
text: Changed name Hurricanes rrricanes. get_storm_data can now chained commands returns list dataframes. load_storm_data accesses pre-scraped datasets returns requested products github repo rrricanesdata. done make quicker get data. relied get immediate data current storms. However, fairly --date. Original functions can used reason immediate data access needed. saffir returns Saffir-Simpson classification tropical cyclones; abbreviated. status_abbr_to_str converts storm status abbreviations (.e., TD, TS, HU) string. twoal twoep parse tropical weather outlook XML files. Gives current status, , areas interest either basin.
